intro: Helicteres cuneata, commonly known as the narrowleaf helicteres, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a distinct cuneate (wedge-shaped) base. The flowers are usually yellow or orange, with five petals and numerous stamens, and the plant produces capsule fruits containing numerous seeds.
